entries.meaning: (chiefly figurative) That which outweighs; excessive weight.
examples: And I hope, the known avowed use and experience of such great Men, and those in so great a number, is an abundant overpoise to the contrary Affirmation of this, or any other Novel Author whatsoever.

verbs.description: overpoise (third-person singular simple present overpoises, present participle overpoising, simple past and past participle overpoised)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To exceed in importance, strength or value.
(obsolete) To place excessive weight on (someone or something).
(obsolete) To throw (someone or something) off balance.
